name: Hotel Santiago Park Plaza

reviews.text: This hotel was nice. The rooms were clean and spacious. I was there for business and it was in a great location. I was able to walk or talk the train everywhere from the hotel. Overall, I would recommend staying at the Park Plaza.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

reviews.text: This was a lovely little hotel. I flew in from Australia and was so jetlagged and they checked me in early and gave me an end quiet room. Bottle of wine in your room is an excellent touch, and I loved the small nightcap they brought! I'm afraid I didn't see much of the city as I was on my way to Buenos Aires, but I did use the small pool and gym on the top floor with a lovely view. Breakfast was varied, the staff were a bit hit and miss in the restaurant, but very friendly on reception. I did try to use their wireless but had really bad reception in my room.
reviews.title: Lovely small quiet hotel

reviews.text: First of all, it tooks us a while to make up our minds on which hotel to choose. We decided to go with the Park Plaza since it had great reviews from TripAdvisor, good facilities and a very convenient location. The hotel lived up to our expectations and more, from the hotel appointed taxi pick form the airport to the hotel appointed taxi ride back to the airport .
reviews.title: Excellent Park Plaza

likes.liked: — Good facilities, great location, great staff

reviews.text: We traveled with our 16 month old baby and requested prior to our arrival a crib. When we arrived , the crib was very nicely set in our corner room with a nice little pillow and covers. The bed was very comfortable and room was nicely decorated and well maintained. We had breakfast included in our rate and this was also a good surprise for a hotel in South America. Somewhat limited choice of hot plates (scrambled eggs, sausages, bacon, mashed potatoes and that's it ) but great assortment of fruits, which came very handy when feeding our little baby girl! The restaurant staff was very attentive to us and the needs for our little baby!
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel and outstanding value

reviews.text: We were also very happy with the location of the hotel. Many restaurants nearby, a very safe area to walk during nights, metro station 2 blocks away, shopping, coffee shops, etc. We walked by hotels we almost book (Radisson, Crowne Plaza, Marriott) only to make us more happy about the location of the Park Plaza.
reviews.title: Nice accommodation and great value in Providencia

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed for three night and enjoyed the hotel whilst there, the bar and restaraunt downstairs was very good with very friendly staff.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay

reviews.text: They do not seem to have to much tourist information so it would be better to do that research beforehand if required.
reviews.title: I really liked this hotel.

reviews.text: You walk into the main reception to be met by comforting, homely smells. It's beautiful. The rooms are very clean. The housekeeping staff check at the end of every day that you are happy with everything. Breakfast was very poor. I had two evening meals which were very over priced and not good. The buffet lunch is amazing surprisingly. Beautiful salmon, sushi, vegetables - ideal when you have had not breakfast. Need to be careful when using the hotel taxis. They are over priced and the driver I used refused to give my partner his change until he made a fuss. The Concierge in his full regalia organised the taxi and we appealed to him. he did nothing which was disappointing. I stayed therefore 9 nights in February 2009 on business, will be back in April and will definitely stay there again. I can always eat breakfast over the road at Starbucks !!
reviews.title: Awesome location, huge suites, good for little ones

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Park Plaza Apart Suites, just around the corner from the main hotel. When we checked in, after a very long flight with 3 kids, the host gave a wonderful two bedroom suite. It was huge and felt like a big apartment. There was so much room to move around, kids played on the floor, had their own room and bath. Better yet, the location was awesome. Easy to walk to grocery, shopping, restaurants a great neighborhood. In front on the hotel was a tourist bus stop, very nice. Although dining was at the main hotel, you could order in, bring in or eat around the hotel very easily. The staff was very nice and helpful, rooms were clean but a little dated from early 80s when a grey or black toilet was cool. Best of all the price was great for the size of room and service. Highly recommend top floor 2 bedroom.
reviews.title: We loved the Santiago Park Plaza and what a great location!

reviews.text: A wonderful boutique hotel. It is situated in the most perfect location, on a quiet side street, two short blocks from restaurants and shopping. Our room was a nice size and super clean. The staff was great and beyond helpful. Our stay was thoroughly enjoyable. We would recommend it highly and definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: disappointing- average hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose the Santiago Park based on other tripadvisor reviews and we were most satisfied with our choice. The hotel is modern with all amenities and having a rooftop pool was a real bonus.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is well located and in a very good neighborhood.
reviews.title: Great Location!

reviews.text: Rooms were spacious and comfortable with cable TV and minifridge and safe. Wireless wifi has a charge but the hotel provides free access to their business office which has high speed connection and printer available.
reviews.title: Everything was perfect except...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff was very friendly and always helpful in planning itinerary, making reservations, etc. Buffet breakfast in dining room is excellent.
reviews.title: A Real Gem!

reviews.text: Highly recommend this as a place to stay when in Santiago.
reviews.title: Pretty bad overall

likes.disliked: — No cooling, dysfunctional bathroom, no Internet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I visited Santiago during our Honeymoon and chose the Santiago Park Plaza as our base of operations. The hotel is a classically styled, 120 Room hotel located in the center of Providencia, in very close (1 block away) proximity to Los Leones Metro Stop. This enables easy exploration of the city, just watch your wallet when riding the Subway.
reviews.title: Solid, Safe Choice for Santiago

likes.liked: — Location, quality and cleanliness of rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The concierge opened the door for us upon our arrival and let us into the somewhat posh lobby, almost as if we were stepping into the former Helmsley Hotel in New York or a shrunk down Ritz. Check-in was uneventful, and the staff was professional and courteous. One perk was that we got a card to provide feedback, and upon completion, could be redeemed for a free drink at the bar. Make sure you grab an extra one if traveling with a significant other! =)
reviews.title: Great hotel in Santiago

likes.liked: — The pool was awesome and the location near the metro

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We unfortunately did not get the type of room requested, which was a mountain-view room, but the receptionist was willing to work with us to meet our desires for the following nights of our stay. Truth be told, we ended up staying in the same room we originally checked into since the other rooms offered to us did not have that much better of a view.
reviews.title: Dated and Tired

likes.disliked: — Old bathroom, poor breakfast, not much of interest in walking distance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Regardless, the rooms are clean, fresh and classical in their appointments & furnishings. The furniture and linens/blankets were all in great shape and flowed with the décor. A large (~32”) LCD TV adorned the foot of the bed and we had a nice view of the city from our window. Also in the room is a bar-fridge and a safe for storing your valuables. The bed was comfortable, but the down-pillows (or at least what felt like down) were to die for. Those pillows were definitely the key to our restful nights in Santiago.
reviews.title: Good but not great

reviews.text: The bathroom is a little on the small side, but nicely appointed and very clean. Other than that, there is not much to write home about. An interesting feature in the bathroom, however, was the U.S.-Style 120-Volt Outlet, and it definitely hinted towards this hotels general clientele. Nevertheless, it was nice not to have to break out the converter for once on our trip.
reviews.title: Down town Santiago

description: The Santiago Park Plaza is a five star boutique hotel, in classic English style, with cutting edge technology, at the service of today’s businessman. We have introduced a concept of closeness and empathy with our guests, which has become the hallmark of our hotel.
